verses.verse: Then the LORD<WH3068> answered<WH6030> <WH853> Job<WH347> out of<WH4480> the whirlwind,<WH5591> and said,<WH559>
Who <WH4310> is this<WH2088> that darkeneth<WH2821> counsel<WH6098> by words<WH4405> without<WH1097> knowledge?<WH1847>
Gird up<WH247> now<WH4994> thy loins<WH2504> like a man;<WH1397> for I will demand<WH7592> of thee, and answer<WH3045> thou me.
Where <WH375> wast<WH1961> thou when I laid the foundations<WH3245> of the earth?<WH776> declare,<WH5046> if<WH518> thou hast understanding.<WH3045> <WH998>
Who <WH4310> hath laid<WH7760> the measures<WH4461> thereof, if<WH3588> thou knowest?<WH3045> or<WH176> who<WH4310> hath stretched<WH5186> the line<WH6957> upon<WH5921> it?
Whereupon <WH5921> <WH4100> are the foundations<WH134> thereof fastened?<WH2883> or<WH176> who<WH4310> laid<WH3384> the corner<WH6438> stone<WH68> thereof;
When the morning<WH1242> stars<WH3556> sang<WH7442> together,<WH3162> and all<WH3605> the sons<WH1121> of God<WH430> shouted for joy?<WH7321>
Or who shut up<WH5526> the sea<WH3220> with doors,<WH1817> when it broke forth,<WH1518> as if it had issued out<WH3318> of the womb?<WH4480> <WH7358>
When I made<WH7760> the cloud<WH6051> the garment<WH3830> thereof, and thick darkness<WH6205> a swaddling band<WH2854> for it,
And broke up<WH7665> for<WH5921> it my decreed<WH2706> place, and set<WH7760> bars<WH1280> and doors,<WH1817>
And said,<WH559> Hitherto<WH5704> <WH6311> shalt thou come,<WH935> but no<WH3808> further:<WH3254> and here<WH6311> shall thy proud<WH1347> waves<WH1530> be stayed?<WH7896>
Hast thou commanded<WH6680> the morning<WH1242> since thy days;<WH4480> <WH3117> and caused the dayspring<WH7837> to know<WH3045> his place;<WH4725>
That it might take hold<WH270> of the ends<WH3671> of the earth,<WH776> that the wicked<WH7563> might be shaken<WH5287> out of<WH4480> it?
It is turned<WH2015> as clay<WH2563> to the seal;<WH2368> and they stand<WH3320> as<WH3644> a garment.<WH3830>
And from the wicked<WH4480> <WH7563> their light<WH216> is withheld,<WH4513> and the high<WH7311> arm<WH2220> shall be broken.<WH7665>
Hast thou entered<WH935> into<WH5704> the springs<WH5033> of the sea?<WH3220> or hast thou walked<WH1980> in the search<WH2714> of the depth?<WH8415>
Have the gates<WH8179> of death<WH4194> been opened<WH1540> unto thee? or hast thou seen<WH7200> the doors<WH8179> of the shadow of death?<WH6757>
Hast thou perceived<WH995> <WH5704> the breadth<WH7338> of the earth?<WH776> declare<WH5046> if<WH518> thou knowest<WH3045> it all.<WH3605>
Where <WH335> <WH2088> is the way<WH1870> where light<WH216> dwelleth?<WH7931> and as for darkness,<WH2822> where<WH335> <WH2088> is the place<WH4725> thereof,
That <WH3588> thou shouldest take<WH3947> it to<WH413> the bound<WH1366> thereof, and that<WH3588> thou shouldest know<WH995> the paths<WH5410> to the house<WH1004> thereof?
Knowest <WH3045> thou it, because<WH3588> thou wast then<WH227> born?<WH3205> or because the number<WH4557> of thy days<WH3117> is great?<WH7227>
Hast thou entered<WH935> into<WH413> the treasures<WH214> of the snow?<WH7950> or hast thou seen<WH7200> the treasures<WH214> of the hail,<WH1259>
Which <WH834> I have reserved<WH2820> against the time<WH6256> of trouble,<WH6862> against the day<WH3117> of battle<WH7128> and war?<WH4421>
By what<WH335> <WH2088> way<WH1870> is the light<WH216> parted,<WH2505> which scattereth<WH6327> the east wind<WH6921> upon<WH5921> the earth?<WH776>
Who <WH4310> hath divided<WH6385> a watercourse<WH8585> for the overflowing of waters,<WH7858> or a way<WH1870> for the lightning<WH2385> of thunder;<WH6963>
To cause it to rain<WH4305> on<WH5921> the earth,<WH776> where no<WH3808> man<WH376> is; on the wilderness,<WH4057> wherein there is no<WH3808> man;<WH120>
To satisfy<WH7646> the desolate<WH7722> and waste<WH4875> ground; and to cause the bud<WH4161> of the tender herb<WH1877> to spring forth?<WH6779>
Hath <WH3426> the rain<WH4306> a father?<WH1> or<WH176> who<WH4310> hath begotten<WH3205> the drops<WH96> of dew?<WH2919>
Out of whose womb<WH4480> <WH990> <WH4310> came<WH3318> the ice?<WH7140> and the hoary frost<WH3713> of heaven,<WH8064> who<WH4310> hath engendered<WH3205> it?
The waters<WH4325> are hid<WH2244> as with a stone,<WH68> and the face<WH6440> of the deep<WH8415> is frozen.<WH3920>
Canst thou bind<WH7194> the sweet influences<WH4575> of Pleiades,<WH3598> or<WH176> loose<WH6605> the bands<WH4189> of Orion?<WH3685>
Canst thou bring forth<WH3318> Mazzaroth<WH4216> in his season?<WH6256> or canst thou guide<WH5148> Arcturus<WH5906> with<WH5921> his sons?<WH1121>
Knowest <WH3045> thou the ordinances<WH2708> of heaven?<WH8064> canst thou set<WH7760> the dominion<WH4896> thereof in the earth?<WH776>
Canst thou lift up<WH7311> thy voice<WH6963> to the clouds,<WH5645> that abundance<WH8229> of waters<WH4325> may cover<WH3680> thee?
Canst thou send<WH7971> lightnings,<WH1300> that they may go,<WH1980> and say<WH559> unto thee, Here<WH2009> we are?
Who <WH4310> hath put<WH7896> wisdom<WH2451> in the inward parts?<WH2910> or<WH176> who<WH4310> hath given<WH5414> understanding<WH998> to the heart?<WH7907>
Who <WH4310> can number<WH5608> the clouds<WH7834> in wisdom?<WH2451> or who<WH4310> can stay<WH7901> the bottles<WH5035> of heaven,<WH8064>
When the dust<WH6083> groweth<WH3332> into hardness,<WH4165> and the clods<WH7263> cleave fast together?<WH1692>
Wilt thou hunt<WH6679> the prey<WH2964> for the lion?<WH3833> or fill<WH4390> the appetite<WH2416> of the young lions,<WH3715>
When <WH3588> they couch<WH7817> in their dens,<WH4585> and abide<WH3427> in the covert<WH5521> to lie in wait?<WH3926> <WH695>
Who <WH4310> provideth<WH3559> for the raven<WH6158> his food?<WH6718> when<WH3588> his young ones<WH3206> cry<WH7768> unto<WH413> God,<WH410> they wander<WH8582> for lack<WH1097> of meat.<WH400>
